NODE.title: GMP 1.1
NODE.description: Make sense of your problem.

NODE.title: GMP 1.2
NODE.description: Reflect on your thinking as you solve your problem.

NODE.title: GMP 1.3
NODE.description: Keep trying when your problem is hard.

NODE.title: GMP 1.4
NODE.description: Check whether your answer makes sense.

NODE.title: GMP 1.5
NODE.description: Solve problems in more than one way.

NODE.title: GMP 1.6
NODE.description: Compare the strategies you and others use.

NODE.title: GMP 2.1
NODE.description: Create mathematical representations using numbers, words, pictures, symbols, gestures, tables, graphs, and concrete objects.

NODE.title: GMP 2.2
NODE.description: Make sense of the representations you and others use.

NODE.title: GMP 2.3
NODE.description: Make connections between representations.

NODE.title: GMP 3.1
NODE.description: Make mathematical conjectures and arguments.

NODE.title: GMP 3.2
NODE.description: Make sense of others’ mathematical thinking.

NODE.title: GMP 4.1
NODE.description: Model real-world situations using graphs, drawings, tables, symbols, numbers, diagrams, and other representations.

NODE.title: GMP 4.2
NODE.description: Use mathematical models to solve problems and answer questions.

NODE.title: GMP 5.1
NODE.description: Choose appropriate tools.

NODE.title: GMP 5.2
NODE.description: Use tools effectively and make sense of your results.

NODE.title: GMP 6.1
NODE.description: Explain your mathematical thinking clearly and precisely.

NODE.title: GMP 6.2
NODE.description: Use an appropriate level of precision for your problem.

NODE.title: GMP 6.3
NODE.description: Use clear labels, units, and mathematical language.

NODE.title: GMP 6.4
NODE.description: Think about accuracy and efficiency when you count, measure, and calculate.

NODE.title: GMP 7.1
NODE.description: Look for mathematical structures such as categories, patterns, and properties.

NODE.title: GMP 7.2
NODE.description: Use structures to solve problems and answer questions.

NODE.title: GMP 8.1
NODE.description: Create and justify rules, shortcuts, and generalizations.

NODE.title: K.CC.1_1
NODE.description: Count by 1s.

NODE.title: K.CC.1_2
NODE.description: Count by 10s.

NODE.title: K.CC.2_1
NODE.description: Count on from numbers other than 1.

NODE.description: Read numbers.

NODE.title: K.CC.3_2
NODE.description: Write numbers.

NODE.title: K.CC.3_3
NODE.description: Represent quantities with numerals.

NODE.title: K.CC.4a_1_a
NODE.description: Count objects with the correct count sequence.

NODE.title: K.CC.4a_1_b
NODE.description: Count objects with one-to-one correspondence.

NODE.title: K.CC.4b_1
NODE.description: Understand the cardinal principle.

NODE.title: K.CC.4b_2
NODE.description: Understand conservation of number.

NODE.title: K.CC.4c_1
NODE.description: Understand the successor function.

NODE.title: K.CC.5_1_a
NODE.description: Count groups of arranged objects.

NODE.title: K.CC.5_1_b
NODE.description: Count groups of scattered objects.

NODE.title: K.CC.5_2
NODE.description: Count out a given number of objects.

NODE.title: K.CC.6_1
NODE.description: Compare groups by number of objects.

NODE.title: K.CC.7_1
NODE.description: Compare numbers as written numerals.

NODE.title: K.OA.1_1_a
NODE.description: Represent addition concretely or verbally.

NODE.title: K.OA.1_1_b
NODE.description: Represent addition with numerals and symbols.

NODE.title: K.OA.1_1_c
NODE.description: Represent subtraction concretely or verbally.

NODE.title: K.OA.1_1_d
NODE.description: Represent subtraction with numerals and symbols.

NODE.title: K.OA.2_1
NODE.description: Solve number stories and problems involving addition and subtraction.

NODE.title: K.OA.3_1
NODE.description: Decompose numbers in more than one way.

NODE.title: K.OA.3_2
NODE.description: Record decompositions of numbers.

NODE.title: K.OA.4_1
NODE.description: Find number pairs that add to 10.

NODE.title: K.OA.4_2
NODE.description: Record number pairs that add to 10.

NODE.title: K.OA.5_1
NODE.description: Develop strategies for addition and subtraction facts.

NODE.title: K.OA.5_2
NODE.description: Add within 5 fluently.

NODE.title: K.OA.5_3
NODE.description: Subtract within 5 fluently.

NODE.title: K.NBT.1_1
NODE.description: Partition and represent numbers 11–19 as ten ones and some more ones.

NODE.title: K.NBT.1_3
NODE.description: Understand numbers 11–19 as ten ones and some more ones.

NODE.title: K.MD.1_1
NODE.description: Describe measurable attributes of objects.

NODE.title: K.MD.2_1
NODE.description: Compare measurable attributes of objects directly.

NODE.title: K.MD.3_1
NODE.description: Classify, count, and order categories by count.

NODE.title: K.G.1_1
NODE.description: Identify 2-dimensional shapes in the environment.

NODE.title: K.G.1_2
NODE.description: Identify 3-dimensional shapes in the environment.

NODE.title: K.G.1_3
NODE.description: Describe the positions of objects in the environment.

NODE.title: K.G.2_1
NODE.description: Name 2-dimensional shapes.

NODE.title: K.G.2_2
NODE.description: Name 3-dimensional shapes.

NODE.title: K.G.3_1
NODE.description: Identify shapes as 2-dimensional or 3-dimensional.

NODE.description: Analyze and describe 2-dimensional shapes.

NODE.title: K.G.4_1_b
NODE.description: Compare 2-dimensional shapes.

NODE.description: Analyze and describe 3-dimensional shapes.

NODE.title: K.G.4_2_b
NODE.description: Compare 3-dimensional shapes.

NODE.title: K.G.5_1
NODE.description: Model shapes in the world.

NODE.title: K.G.6_1
NODE.description: Compose shapes from other shapes.

NODE.title: 1.OA.1_1
NODE.description: Solve number stories by adding and subtracting.

NODE.title: 1.OA.1_2
NODE.description: Model parts-and-total, change, and comparison situations.

NODE.title: 1.OA.2_1
NODE.description: Model and solve number stories involving the addition of 3 addends.

NODE.title: 1.OA.3_1
NODE.description: Apply properties of operations to add or subtract.

NODE.title: 1.OA.4_1
NODE.description: Understand subtraction as an unknown-addend problem.

NODE.title: 1.OA.5_1
NODE.description: Relate counting to addition and subtraction.

NODE.title: 1.OA.6_1
NODE.description: Recognize and decompose quantities up to 20 using visual patterns.

NODE.title: 1.OA.6_2_a
NODE.description: Add within 10 fluently.

NODE.title: 1.OA.6_2_b
NODE.description: Subtract within 10 fluently.

NODE.title: 1.OA.6_3_a
NODE.description: Add doubles automatically.

NODE.title: 1.OA.6_3_b
NODE.description: Subtract doubles.

NODE.title: 1.OA.6_3_c
NODE.description: Add combinations of 10 automatically.

NODE.title: 1.OA.6_3_d
NODE.description: Subtract combinations of 10.

NODE.title: 1.OA.6_4
NODE.description: Add and subtract within 20 using strategies.

NODE.title: 1.OA.7_1_a
NODE.description: Understand the meaning of the equal sign.

NODE.title: 1.OA.7_1_b
NODE.description: Determine whether equations involving addition or subtraction are true or false.

NODE.title: 1.OA.8_1
NODE.description: Find the unknown in addition and subtraction equations.

NODE.title: 1.NBT.1_1
NODE.description: Count on from any number.

NODE.title: 1.NBT.1_2
NODE.description: Read and write numbers.

NODE.title: 1.NBT.1_3
NODE.description: Count and represent collections of objects with numerals.

NODE.title: 1.NBT.2_1
NODE.description: Represent whole numbers as tens and ones.

NODE.title: 1.NBT.2_2
NODE.description: Understand exchanging tens and ones.

NODE.title: 1.NBT.2_3_a
NODE.description: Understand place value.

NODE.title: 1.NBT.2_3_b
NODE.description: Understand 11 to 19 as a ten and some ones.

NODE.title: 1.NBT.2_3_c
NODE.description: Understand 10, 20, …, 90 as some tens and no ones.

NODE.title: 1.NBT.3_1
NODE.description: Compare and order numbers.

NODE.title: 1.NBT.3_2
NODE.description: Record comparisons using >, =, or <.

NODE.title: 1.NBT.4_1
NODE.description: Understand adding 2-digit numbers and 1-digit numbers.

NODE.title: 1.NBT.4_2
NODE.description: Understand adding 2-digit numbers and multiples of 10.

NODE.title: 1.NBT.4_3
NODE.description: Understand adding 2-digit numbers.

NODE.title: 1.NBT.5_1
NODE.description: Mentally find 10 more or 10 less than a 2-digit number.

NODE.title: 1.NBT.6_1
NODE.description: Subtract multiples of 10 from multiples of 10.

NODE.title: 1.MD.1_1
NODE.description: Order objects by length.

NODE.title: 1.MD.1_2
NODE.description: Compare the lengths of objects indirectly.

NODE.title: 1.MD.2_2
NODE.description: Express length as a whole number of units.

NODE.title: 1.MD.2_3
NODE.description: Measure length using same-size units with no gaps or overlaps.

NODE.title: 1.MD.3_1_a
NODE.description: Tell and write time using analog clocks.

NODE.title: 1.MD.3_1_b
NODE.description: Tell and write time using digital clocks.

NODE.title: 1.MD.4_1
NODE.description: Organize and represent data.

NODE.title: 1.MD.4_2_a
NODE.description: Ask questions about data.

NODE.title: 1.MD.4_2_b
NODE.description: Answer questions about data.

NODE.title: 1.G.1_1
NODE.description: Build and draw shapes to possess defining attributes.

NODE.title: 1.G.1_2
NODE.description: Distinguish between defining and non-defining attributes.

NODE.title: 1.G.2_1_a
NODE.description: Build composite shapes.

NODE.title: 1.G.2_1_b
NODE.description: Compose new shapes from composite shapes.

NODE.description: Partition shapes into equal shares.

NODE.title: 1.G.3_1_b
NODE.description: Describe equal shares using fraction words.

NODE.description: Describe the whole as a number of shares.

NODE.description: Understand that more equal shares means smaller equal shares.

NODE.description: Use addition and subtraction to solve 1-step number stories.

NODE.description: Use addition and subtraction to solve 2-step number stories.

NODE.description: Model 1-step problems involving addition and subtraction.

NODE.description: Model 2-step problems involving addition and subtraction.

NODE.description: Add within 20 fluently.

NODE.title: 2.OA.2_1_b
NODE.description: Subtract within 20 fluently.

NODE.description: Know all sums of two 1-digit numbers automatically.

NODE.description: Determine whether the number of objects in a group is odd or even.

NODE.title: 2.OA.3_2
NODE.description: Express an even number as a sum of two equal addends.

NODE.description: Find the total number of objects in a rectangular array.

NODE.title: 2.OA.4_2
NODE.description: Express the number of objects in an array as a sum of equal addends.

NODE.title: 2.NBT.1_1_a
NODE.description: Understand 3-digit place value.

NODE.title: 2.NBT.1_1_b
NODE.description: Represent whole numbers as hundreds, tens, and ones.

NODE.description: Understand exchanging tens and hundreds.

NODE.title: 2.NBT.1b_1
NODE.description: Understand 100, 200, …, 900 as some hundreds, no tens, and no ones.

NODE.title: 2.NBT.2_1_a
NODE.description: Count by 1s.

NODE.title: 2.NBT.2_1_b
NODE.description: Count by 5s, 10s, and 100s.

NODE.description: Read and write numbers.

NODE.title: 2.NBT.3_1_b
NODE.description: Read and write number names.

NODE.title: 2.NBT.3_1_c
NODE.description: Read and write numbers in expanded form.

NODE.title: 2.NBT.4_1
NODE.description: Compare and order numbers.

NODE.title: 2.NBT.4_2
NODE.description: Record comparisons using >, =, or <.

NODE.title: 2.NBT.5_1_a
NODE.description: Add within 100 fluently.

NODE.title: 2.NBT.5_1_b
NODE.description: Subtract within 100 fluently.

NODE.description: Add up to four 2-digit numbers.

NODE.description: Add multidigit numbers using models or strategies.

NODE.title: 2.NBT.7_1_b
NODE.description: Subtract multidigit numbers using models or strategies.

NODE.description: Mentally add 10 to and subtract 10 from a given number.

NODE.description: Mentally add 100 to and subtract 100 from a given number.

NODE.description: Explain why addition and subtraction strategies work.

NODE.description: Measure the length of an object.

NODE.title: 2.MD.1_1_b
NODE.description: Select appropriate tools to measure length.

NODE.title: 2.MD.2_1
NODE.description: Measure an object using 2 different units of length.

NODE.description: Describe how length measurements relate to the size of the unit.

NODE.description: Estimate lengths.

NODE.description: Measure to determine how much longer one object is than another.

NODE.description: Solve number stories involving length by adding or subtracting.

NODE.title: 2.MD.5_1_b
NODE.description: Model number stories involving length.

NODE.description: Represent whole numbers as lengths from 0 on a number-line diagram.

NODE.description: Represent sums and differences on a number-line diagram.

NODE.description: Tell and write time using analog and digital clocks

NODE.description: Use A.M. and P.M.

NODE.description: Solve problems involving coins and bills.

NODE.description: Read and write monetary amounts.

NODE.description: Generate measurement data.

NODE.description: Represent measurement data on a line plot.

NODE.description: Organize and represent data on bar and picture graphs.

NODE.description: Answer questions using information in graphs.

NODE.title: 2.G.1_1
NODE.description: Recognize and draw shapes with specified attributes.

NODE.title: 2.G.1_2
NODE.description: Identify 2- and 3-dimensional shapes.

NODE.title: 2.G.2_1
NODE.description: Partition a rectangle into rows and columns of same-size squares and count to find the total number of squares.

NODE.description: Partition shapes into equal shares.

NODE.title: 2.G.3_1_b
NODE.description: Describe equal shares using fraction words.

NODE.description: Describe the whole as a number of shares.

NODE.description: Recognize that equal shares of a shape need not have the same shape.

NODE.title: 3.OA.1_1
NODE.description: Interpret multiplication in terms of equal groups.

NODE.title: 3.OA.2_1
NODE.description: Interpret division in terms of equal shares or equal groups.

NODE.title: 3.OA.3_1
NODE.description: Use multiplication and division to solve number stories.

NODE.title: 3.OA.3_2
NODE.description: Model number stories involving multiplication and division.

NODE.description: Determine the unknown in multiplication and division equations.

NODE.title: 3.OA.5_1
NODE.description: Apply properties of operations to multiply or divide.

NODE.title: 3.OA.6_1
NODE.description: Understand division as an unknown-factor problem.

NODE.title: 3.OA.7_1
NODE.description: Multiply within 100 fluently.

NODE.title: 3.OA.7_2
NODE.description: Know all products of 1-digit numbers × 1, × 2, × 5, and × 10 automatically.

NODE.title: 3.OA.7_3
NODE.description: Know all square products of 1-digit numbers automatically.

NODE.title: 3.OA.7_4
NODE.description: Know all products of 1-digit numbers × 0, × 3, and × 9 automatically.

NODE.title: 3.OA.7_5
NODE.description: Know all products of 1-digit numbers × 4, × 6, × 7, and × 8 automatically.

NODE.title: 3.OA.7_6
NODE.description: Divide within 100 fluently.

NODE.title: 3.OA.8_1
NODE.description: Assess the reasonableness of answers to problems.

NODE.title: 3.OA.8_2
NODE.description: Solve 2-step number stories involving two of the four operations.

NODE.title: 3.OA.8_3
NODE.description: Model 2-step number stories with equations, using a letter or symbol for the unknown.

NODE.title: 3.OA.8_4
NODE.description: Understand that grouping symbols affect the order in which operations are performed.

NODE.title: 3.OA.8_5
NODE.description: Apply the order of operations when grouping symbols are not present.

NODE.title: 3.OA.9_1
NODE.description: Identify arithmetic patterns and explain them using properties of operations.

NODE.title: 3.NBT.1_1
NODE.description: Use place-value understanding to round whole numbers to the nearest 10.

NODE.title: 3.NBT.1_2
NODE.description: Use place-value understanding to round whole numbers to the nearest 100.

NODE.title: 3.NBT.2_1
NODE.description: Add within 1,000 fluently.

NODE.title: 3.NBT.2_2
NODE.description: Subtract within 1,000 fluently.

NODE.title: 3.NBT.3_1
NODE.description: Multiply 1-digit numbers by multiples of 10.

NODE.title: 3.NF.1_1
NODE.description: Understand, identify, and represent unit fractions as 1 part when a whole is divided into b equal parts.

NODE.title: 3.NF.1_2
NODE.description: Understand, identify, and represent non-unit fractions as the quantity formed by a parts of size 1/b.

NODE.title: 3.NF.1_3
NODE.description: Represent fractions by sharing collections of objects into equal shares.

NODE.title: 3.NF.2a_1
NODE.description: Represent unit fractions on a number-line diagram.

NODE.title: 3.NF.2b_2
NODE.description: Represent non-unit fractions on a number-line diagram.

NODE.title: 3.NF.3a_1
NODE.description: Understand that equivalent fractions are the same size.

NODE.title: 3.NF.3a_2
NODE.description: Understand that equivalent fractions name the same point on a number line.

NODE.title: 3.NF.3b_1
NODE.description: Recognize and generate simple equivalent fractions.

NODE.title: 3.NF.3c_1
NODE.description: Express whole numbers as fractions.

NODE.title: 3.NF.3c_2
NODE.description: Recognize fractions that are equivalent to whole numbers.

NODE.title: 3.NF.3d_1
NODE.description: Compare fractions with the same numerator or the same denominator.

NODE.title: 3.NF.3d_2
NODE.description: Recognize that fraction comparisons require the wholes to be the same size.

NODE.title: 3.NF.3d_3
NODE.description: Record fraction comparisons using >, =, or <.

NODE.title: 3.NF.3d_4
NODE.description: Justify the conclusions of fraction comparisons.

NODE.description: Tell and write time.

NODE.title: 3.MD.1_2
NODE.description: Measure time intervals in minutes.

NODE.title: 3.MD.1_3
NODE.description: Solve number stories involving time intervals by adding or subtracting.

NODE.description: Measure and estimate masses of objects using grams and kilograms.

NODE.title: 3.MD.2_2
NODE.description: Measure and estimate liquid volumes using liters and other units.

NODE.description: Solve 1-step number stories involving mass.

NODE.title: 3.MD.2_4
NODE.description: Solve 1-step number stories involving volume.

NODE.description: Organize and represent data on scaled bar graphs and scaled picture graphs.

NODE.title: 3.MD.3_2
NODE.description: Solve 1- and 2-step problems using information in graphs.

NODE.title: 3.MD.4_1
NODE.description: Measure lengths to the nearest 1/2 inch, 1/4 inch, or whole centimeter.

NODE.title: 3.MD.4_2
NODE.description: Collect, organize, and represent data on line plots.

NODE.title: 3.MD.5a_1
NODE.description: Understand that a unit square has 1 square unit of area and can measure area.

NODE.title: 3.MD.5b_1
NODE.description: Understand that a plane figure completely covered by n unit squares has area n square units.

NODE.title: 3.MD.6_1
NODE.description: Measure areas by counting unit squares.

NODE.description: Find the area of a rectangle by tiling it.

NODE.description: Show that tiling a rectangle results in the same area as multiplying its side lengths.

NODE.title: 3.MD.7b_1
NODE.description: Multiply side lengths to find areas of rectangles.

NODE.title: 3.MD.7b_2
NODE.description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving areas of rectangles.

NODE.title: 3.MD.7b_3
NODE.description: Represent whole-number products as rectangular areas.

NODE.title: 3.MD.7c_1
NODE.description: Use tiling to concretely demonstrate the distributive property.

NODE.title: 3.MD.7c_2
NODE.description: Use area models to represent the distributive property.

NODE.title: 3.MD.7d_1
NODE.description: Recognize area as additive.

NODE.title: 3.MD.7d_2
NODE.description: Solve real-world problems involving areas of rectilinear figures.

NODE.title: 3.MD.8_1
NODE.description: Solve problems involving perimeters of polygons.

NODE.title: 3.MD.8_2
NODE.description: Exhibit rectangles with the same perimeter and different areas or the same area and different perimeters.

NODE.description: Understand that shapes in different categories may share attributes that can define a larger category.

NODE.title: 3.G.1_2
NODE.description: Recognize specified subcategories of quadrilaterals.

NODE.title: 3.G.1_3
NODE.description: Draw quadrilaterals that do not belong to specified subcategories.

NODE.description: Partition shapes into parts with equal areas.

NODE.title: 3.G.2_2
NODE.description: Express the area of each part as a unit fraction of the whole.

NODE.description: Interpret a multiplication equation as a multiplicative comparison and represent statements of multiplicative comparisons as equations.

NODE.title: 4.OA.2_1
NODE.description: Solve number stories involving multiplicative comparison.

NODE.description: Solve multistep number stories involving the four operations, interpreting any remainders.

NODE.description: Model number stories with equations, using a letter for the unknown.

NODE.title: 4.OA.3_3
NODE.description: Assess the reasonableness of answers to number stories and other problems.

NODE.description: Find all factor pairs for a whole number in the range 1–100.

NODE.description: Determine whether a whole number is a multiple of a given 1-digit number.

NODE.title: 4.OA.4_3
NODE.description: Determine whether a whole number is a multiple of a given 1-digit number.

NODE.title: 4.OA.5_1
NODE.description: Generate a number or shape pattern that follows a given rule.

NODE.title: 4.OA.5_2
NODE.description: Identify features of a pattern that were not explicit in the rule.

NODE.description: Recognize the relationship between the places in whole numbers.

NODE.description: Read and write numbers.

NODE.description: Read and write number names.

NODE.description: Read and write numbers in expanded form.

NODE.description: Compare and order multidigit whole numbers.

NODE.description: Record multidigit whole-number comparisons using >, =, or <.

NODE.description: Use place-value understanding to round whole numbers to any place.

NODE.description: Add multidigit whole numbers fluently using the standard algorithm.

NODE.description: Subtract multidigit whole numbers fluently using the standard algorithm.

NODE.description: Multiply a whole number of up to four digits by a 1-digit number and a 2-digit number by a 2-digit number.

NODE.description: Illustrate and explain multiplication strategies and calculations.

NODE.description: Divide a whole number of up to four digits by a 1-digit whole number.

NODE.title: 4.NBT.6_2
NODE.description: Illustrate and explain division strategies and calculations.

NODE.description: Explain fraction equivalence.

NODE.title: 4.NF.1_2
NODE.description: Recognize and generate equivalent fractions.

NODE.description: Recognize that fraction comparisons require same-size wholes.

NODE.description: Compare and order fractions with different numerators and different denominators.

NODE.description: Record fraction comparisons using >, =, or <.

NODE.title: 4.NF.2_4
NODE.description: Justify the conclusions of fraction comparisons.

NODE.description: Understand adding and subtracting fractions as joining and separating parts of the same whole.

NODE.description: Add fractions with like denominators.

NODE.description: Decompose fractions and mixed numbers and represent the decomposition with an equation.

NODE.description: Subtract mixed numbers with like denominators.

NODE.title: 4.NF.3d_1
NODE.description: Solve number stories involving addition and subtraction of fractions with like denominators.

NODE.title: 4.NF.4_1
NODE.description: Multiply a fraction by a whole number using strategies, drawings, and manipulatives to solve problems in context.

NODE.title: 4.NF.4a_1
NODE.description: Understand a fraction a/b as a multiple of 1/b.

NODE.title: 4.NF.4b_1
NODE.description: Multiply a fraction by a whole number.

NODE.title: 4.NF.4c_1
NODE.description: Solve number stories involving multiplication of a fraction by a whole number.

NODE.title: 4.NF.5_1
NODE.description: Add two fractions with respective denominators 10 and 100.

NODE.title: 4.NF.6_1
NODE.description: Represent decimals to hundredths.

NODE.title: 4.NF.6_2
NODE.description: Name decimals using words and base-ten numerals.

NODE.title: 4.NF.6_3
NODE.description: Translate between decimal notation and fractions with denominators 10 or 100.

NODE.title: 4.NF.7_1
NODE.description: Recognize that decimal comparisons require same-size wholes.

NODE.title: 4.NF.7_2
NODE.description: Compare and order decimals.

NODE.title: 4.NF.7_3
NODE.description: Record decimal comparisons using >, =, and <.

NODE.title: 4.NF.7_4
NODE.description: Justify the conclusions of decimal comparisons.

NODE.title: 4.MD.1_1
NODE.description: Know relative sizes of measurement units; express measurements in a larger unit in terms of a smaller unit.

NODE.title: 4.MD.2_1
NODE.description: Solve number stories involving whole numbers of measured quantities.

NODE.title: 4.MD.2_2
NODE.description: Solve number stories involving simple fractions or decimals of measured quantities.

NODE.title: 4.MD.3_1
NODE.description: Apply perimeter formulas for rectangles.

NODE.title: 4.MD.3_2
NODE.description: Apply area formulas for rectangles.

NODE.title: 4.MD.4_1
NODE.description: Organize and represent data on line plots.

NODE.title: 4.MD.4_2
NODE.description: Add or subtract fractions to solve problems involving data on line plots.

NODE.title: 4.MD.5a_1
NODE.description: Recognize and describe angle measure as the amount of a rotation.

NODE.title: 4.MD.5a_2
NODE.description: Recognize 1/360 rotation of a circle (1 degree) as a unit to measure angles.

NODE.title: 4.MD.5b_1
NODE.description: Recognize a measure of an angle as the number of one-degree angles through which it turns.

NODE.title: 4.MD.6_1
NODE.description: Measure angles in whole-number degrees using a protractor.

NODE.title: 4.MD.6_2
NODE.description: Sketch angles of a specified measure.

NODE.title: 4.MD.7_1
NODE.description: Recognize angle measure as additive.

NODE.title: 4.MD.7_2
NODE.description: Add and subtract to solve problems about unknown angles on a diagram.

NODE.title: 4.G.1_1
NODE.description: Draw, represent and identify points, lines, line segments, and rays.

NODE.title: 4.G.1_2
NODE.description: Draw, represent, and identify angles, including right, acute, and obtuse angles.

NODE.title: 4.G.1_3
NODE.description: Draw, represent, and identify perpendicular and parallel lines.

NODE.title: 4.G.2_1
NODE.description: Classify 2-dimensional figures based on line segments or angles.

NODE.title: 4.G.2_2
NODE.description: Recognize right triangles as a category, and identify right triangles.

NODE.title: 4.G.3_1
NODE.description: Recognize that a line of symmetry divides a figure into 2 matching parts.

NODE.title: 4.G.3_2
NODE.description: Identify line-symmetric figures and draw lines of symmetry.

NODE.title: 5.OA.1_1
NODE.description: Write numerical expressions that contain grouping symbols.

NODE.title: 5.OA.1_2
NODE.description: Evaluate expressions that contain grouping symbols.

NODE.title: 5.OA.2_1
NODE.description: Model real-world and mathematical situations using simple expressions.

NODE.title: 5.OA.2_2
NODE.description: Interpret numerical expressions without evaluating them.

NODE.title: 5.OA.3_1
NODE.description: Generate numerical patterns using given rules.

NODE.title: 5.OA.3_2
NODE.description: Identify relationships between corresponding terms of two patterns.

NODE.title: 5.OA.3_3
NODE.description: Form ordered pairs from corresponding terms of patterns and graph them.

NODE.title: 5.NBT.1_1
NODE.description: Understand the relationship between the places in multidigit numbers.

NODE.title: 5.NBT.2_1
NODE.description: Use whole-number exponents to denote powers of 10.

NODE.title: 5.NBT.2_2
NODE.description: Multiply whole numbers by powers of 10; explain the number of zeros in the product.

NODE.title: 5.NBT.2_3
NODE.description: Multiply or divide decimals by powers of 10; explain the decimal-point placement in the answer.

NODE.title: 5.NBT.3a_1
NODE.description: Represent decimals.

NODE.title: 5.NBT.3a_2
NODE.description: Read and write decimals using numerals.

NODE.title: 5.NBT.3a_3
NODE.description: Read and write decimals using number names.

NODE.title: 5.NBT.3a_4
NODE.description: Read and write decimals in expanded form.

NODE.title: 5.NBT.3b_1
NODE.description: Compare and order decimals.

NODE.title: 5.NBT.3b_2
NODE.description: Record decimal comparisons using >, =, or <.

NODE.title: 5.NBT.4_1
NODE.description: Use place-value understanding to round decimals to any place.

NODE.title: 5.NBT.5_1
NODE.description: Fluently multiply multidigit whole numbers using the standard algorithm.

NODE.title: 5.NBT.6_1
NODE.description: Divide multidigit whole numbers.

NODE.title: 5.NBT.6_2
NODE.description: Illustrate and explain solutions to division problems.

NODE.title: 5.NBT.7_1
NODE.description: Make and use estimates for decimal addition and subtraction problems.

NODE.title: 5.NBT.7_2
NODE.description: Add and subtract decimals using models or strategies.

NODE.title: 5.NBT.7_3
NODE.description: Explain decimal addition and subtraction strategies.

NODE.title: 5.NBT.7_4
NODE.description: Multiply and divide decimals using models or strategies.

NODE.title: 5.NBT.7_5
NODE.description: Explain decimal multiplication and division strategies.

NODE.title: 5.NBT.7_6
NODE.description: Make and use estimates for decimal multiplication and division problems.

NODE.title: 5.NF.1_1
NODE.description: Add and subtract fractions with unlike denominators.

NODE.title: 5.NF.1_2
NODE.description: Add and subtract mixed numbers with unlike denominators.

NODE.title: 5.NF.2_1
NODE.description: Solve number stories involving fraction addition and subtraction.

NODE.title: 5.NF.2_2
NODE.description: Use estimates to reason about sums and differences of fractions.

NODE.title: 5.NF.3_1
NODE.description: Interpret a fraction as division of a numerator by a denominator.

NODE.title: 5.NF.3_2
NODE.description: Solve number stories involving whole-number division that leads to fractional answers.

NODE.title: 5.NF.4_1
NODE.description: Multiply fractions by whole numbers.

NODE.title: 5.NF.4_2
NODE.description: Multiply fractions by fractions.

NODE.title: 5.NF.4_3
NODE.description: Multiply mixed numbers by whole numbers, fractions, and mixed numbers.

NODE.title: 5.NF.4a_1
NODE.description: Interpret (1/b) × q as 1 part of a partition of q into b equal parts.

NODE.title: 5.NF.4a_2
NODE.description: Interpret (a/b) × q as a parts of a partition of q into b equal parts.

NODE.title: 5.NF.4a_3
NODE.description: Create story contexts for fraction multiplication problems.

NODE.title: 5.NF.4b_1
NODE.description: Justify the area formula for a rectangle with fractional side lengths by tiling.

NODE.title: 5.NF.4b_2
NODE.description: Find the areas of rectangles with fractional side lengths by multiplying.

NODE.title: 5.NF.4b_3
NODE.description: Represent fraction products as rectangular areas.

NODE.title: 5.NF.5a_1
NODE.description: Compare the size of a product to one factor based on the size of the other factor.

NODE.title: 5.NF.5b_1
NODE.description: Explain the effects of multiplying by fractions greater than 1 or less than 1.

NODE.title: 5.NF.5b_2
NODE.description: Explain the effects of multiplying by fractions equal to 1.

NODE.title: 5.NF.6_1
NODE.description: Solve real-world problems involving fraction multiplication.

NODE.title: 5.NF.6_2
NODE.description: Solve real-world problems involving mixed-number multiplication.

NODE.title: 5.NF.7a_1
NODE.description: Interpret division of a unit fraction by a nonzero whole number and find quotients.

NODE.title: 5.NF.7b_1
NODE.description: Interpret division of a whole number by a unit fraction and find quotients.

NODE.title: 5.NF.7c_1
NODE.description: Solve real-world problems involving division of unit fractions by whole numbers.

NODE.title: 5.NF.7c_2
NODE.description: Solve real-world problems involving division of whole numbers by unit fractions.

NODE.title: 5.MD.1_1
NODE.description: Convert among measurement units within the same system.

NODE.title: 5.MD.1_2
NODE.description: Use measurement conversions to solve multi-step, real-world problems.

NODE.title: 5.MD.2_1
NODE.description: Organize and represent data on line plots.

NODE.title: 5.MD.2_2
NODE.description: Solve problems involving fractional data on line plots.

NODE.title: 5.MD.3_1
NODE.description: Recognize volume as an attribute of solid figures.

NODE.title: 5.MD.3a_1
NODE.description: Understand that a unit cube has 1 cubic unit of volume and can measure volume.

NODE.title: 5.MD.3b_1
NODE.description: Understand that a solid figure completely filled by n unit cubes has volume n cubic units.

NODE.title: 5.MD.4_1
NODE.description: Measure volumes by counting unit cubes and improvised units.

NODE.title: 5.MD.5a_1
NODE.description: Relate packing prisms with cubes to volume formulas.

NODE.title: 5.MD.5a_2
NODE.description: Represent products of three whole numbers as volumes.

NODE.title: 5.MD.5b_1
NODE.description: Apply formulas to find volumes of rectangular prisms.

NODE.title: 5.MD.5b_2
NODE.description: Solve real-world problems involving volumes of figures composed of prisms.

NODE.title: 5.G.1_1
NODE.description: Understand and use a Cartesian coordinate grid in two dimensions.

NODE.title: 5.G.2_1
NODE.description: Represent problems by graphing points in the first quadrant.

NODE.title: 5.G.2_2
NODE.description: Interpret coordinate values of points in context.

NODE.title: 5.G.3_1
NODE.description: Understand that shapes in a subcategory have all the attributes of shapes in the parent category.

NODE.title: 5.G.4_1
NODE.description: Classify 2-dimensional figures in a hierarchy based on properties.

NODE.title: 6.RP.1_1
NODE.description: Explain the concept of ratio and use ratio notation.

NODE.title: 6.RP.1_2
NODE.description: Use ratio language to describe ratio relationships.

NODE.title: 6.RP.2_1
NODE.description: Translate between the unit rate a/b and the ratio a:b (b ≠ 0).

NODE.title: 6.RP.2_2
NODE.description: Use rate language in the context of a ratio relationship.

NODE.title: 6.RP.3_1
NODE.description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems using proportional reasoning.

NODE.title: 6.RP.3a_1
NODE.description: Complete rate and ratio tables.

NODE.title: 6.RP.3a_2
NODE.description: Compare rates and ratios using rate tables.

NODE.title: 6.RP.3a_3
NODE.description: Plot pairs of values for rates or ratios on the coordinate plane.

NODE.title: 6.RP.3b_1
NODE.description: Solve unit rate problems.

NODE.title: 6.RP.3c_1
NODE.description: Solve rate problems involving percents to find the part.

NODE.title: 6.RP.3c_2
NODE.description: Solve rate problems involving percents to find the part.

NODE.title: 6.RP.3d_1
NODE.description: Use ratio reasoning to convert measurement units.

NODE.title: 6.RP.3d_2
NODE.description: Manipulate and transform units when multiplying or dividing quantities.

NODE.title: 6.NS.1_1
NODE.description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions.

NODE.title: 6.NS.1_2
NODE.description: Solve word problems involving division of fractions by fractions.

NODE.title: 6.NS.2_1
NODE.description: Divide multidigit numbers using the standard algorithm.

NODE.title: 6.NS.3_1
NODE.description: Add multidigit decimals using the standard algorithm.

NODE.title: 6.NS.3_2
NODE.description: Subtract multidigit decimals using the standard algorithm.

NODE.title: 6.NS.3_3
NODE.description: Multiply multidigit decimals using the standard algorithm.

NODE.title: 6.NS.3_4
NODE.description: Divide multidigit decimals using the standard algorithm.

NODE.title: 6.NS.4_1
NODE.description: Find the greatest common factor of two whole numbers less than or equal to 100.

NODE.title: 6.NS.4_2
NODE.description: Find the least common multiple of two whole numbers less than or equal to 12.

NODE.title: 6.NS.4_3
NODE.description: Recognize and use the distributive property with whole numbers.

NODE.title: 6.NS.5_1
NODE.description: Recognize that positive numbers and negative numbers represent opposite directions or values.

NODE.title: 6.NS.5_2
NODE.description: Use positive and negative numbers in real-world contexts.

NODE.title: 6.NS.5_3
NODE.description: Explain the meaning of 0 in real-world contexts.

NODE.title: 6.NS.6a_1
NODE.description: Recognize that opposite signs indicate opposite sides of 0 on a number line.

NODE.title: 6.NS.6a_2
NODE.description: Recognize that the opposite of the opposite of a number is the number itself and that zero is its own opposite.

NODE.title: 6.NS.6b_1
NODE.description: Relate the signs in ordered pairs to the quadrants of the coordinate plane.

NODE.title: 6.NS.6b_2
NODE.description: Relate ordered pairs differing only by signs to reflections across the axes.

NODE.title: 6.NS.6c_1
NODE.description: Find and plot rational numbers on a horizontal or vertical number line.

NODE.title: 6.NS.6c_2
NODE.description: Find and plot ordered pairs of rational numbers on a coordinate plane.

NODE.title: 6.NS.7a_1
NODE.description: Describe the relative position of rational numbers on a number line.

NODE.title: 6.NS.7b_1
NODE.description: Write, interpret, and explain rational-number inequalities in context.

NODE.title: 6.NS.7c_1
NODE.description: Interpret absolute values of numbers as distances from 0 on a number line.

NODE.title: 6.NS.7c_2
NODE.description: Interpret absolute values of numbers as magnitudes in real-world situations.

NODE.title: 6.NS.7d_1
NODE.description: Distinguish comparisons of absolute value from statements about order.

NODE.title: 6.NS.8_1
NODE.description: Solve problems by graphing points in all quadrants of the coordinate plane.

NODE.title: 6.NS.8_2
NODE.description: Use absolute value to find distances between points that share a coordinate.

NODE.title: 6.EE.1_1
NODE.description: Write numerical expressions involving whole-number exponents.

NODE.title: 6.EE.1_2
NODE.description: Evaluate numerical expressions involving whole-number exponents.

NODE.title: 6.EE.2a_1
NODE.description: Write algebraic expressions with numerals, symbols, and variables.

NODE.title: 6.EE.2b_1
NODE.description: Use mathematical language to describe parts of expressions.

NODE.title: 6.EE.2c_1
NODE.description: Evaluate algebraic expressions and formulas used in real-world contexts.

NODE.title: 6.EE.2c_2
NODE.description: Perform operations according to the conventional Order of Operations.

NODE.title: 6.EE.3_1
NODE.description: Generate equivalent expressions using properties of operations.

NODE.title: 6.EE.4_1
NODE.description: Identify equivalent expressions.

NODE.title: 6.EE.5_1
NODE.description: Solve equations.

NODE.title: 6.EE.5_2
NODE.description: Solve inequalities.

NODE.title: 6.EE.5_3
NODE.description: Use substitution to determine whether an equation is true.

NODE.title: 6.EE.5_4
NODE.description: Use substitution to determine whether an inequality is true.

NODE.title: 6.EE.6_1
NODE.description: Model problems by writing algebraic expressions involving variables.

NODE.title: 6.EE.6_2
NODE.description: Recognize whether a variable stands for one unknown number or any number in a specified set.

NODE.title: 6.EE.7_1
NODE.description: Solve problems by writing and solving equations.

NODE.title: 6.EE.8_1
NODE.description: Write inequalities to represent constraints or conditions in problems.

NODE.title: 6.EE.8_2
NODE.description: Describe and represent solutions for inequalities on number-line diagrams.

NODE.title: 6.EE.9_1
NODE.description: Write equations to model real-world problems in which one variable changes in relation to the other.

NODE.title: 6.EE.9_2
NODE.description: Analyze the relationship between dependent and independent variables.

NODE.title: 6.G.1_1
NODE.description: Compose and decompose polygons to solve problems involving area.

NODE.title: 6.G.2_1
NODE.description: Justify the volume formula for a prism with fractional edge lengths by packing it with unit-fraction cubes.

NODE.title: 6.G.2_2
NODE.description: Solve problems involving finding the volume of right rectangular prisms.

NODE.title: 6.G.3_1
NODE.description: Draw polygons in a coordinate plane given coordinates for the vertices.

NODE.title: 6.G.3_2
NODE.description: Use the coordinates of the vertices of a polygon to find its side lengths.

NODE.title: 6.G.3_3
NODE.description: Solve problems involving polygons on the coordinate plane.

NODE.title: 6.G.4_1
NODE.description: Represent 3-dimensional figures with nets.

NODE.title: 6.G.4_2
NODE.description: Use nets to find the surface area of 3-dimensional figures.

NODE.title: 6.G.4_3
NODE.description: Solve problems involving surface area of 3-dimensional figures.

NODE.title: 6.SP.1_1
NODE.description: Recognize and formulate statistical questions that anticipate variability in data.

NODE.title: 6.SP.2_1
NODE.description: Recognize that the set of answers to a statistical question has a describable distribution.

NODE.title: 6.SP.3_1
NODE.description: Recognize that a measure of central tendency summarizes a numerical data set with a single number.

NODE.title: 6.SP.3_2
NODE.description: Recognize that a measure of variation describes the variability in a numerical data set with a single number.

NODE.title: 6.SP.4_1
NODE.description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line.

NODE.title: 6.SP.5a_1
NODE.description: Summarize numerical data sets in relation to the number of data points.

NODE.title: 6.SP.5b_1
NODE.description: Describe the nature of the attribute under investigation.

NODE.title: 6.SP.5c_1
NODE.description: Find measures of central tendency for a data set, such as mean and median.

NODE.title: 6.SP.5c_2
NODE.description: Find measures of variability for a data set, such as interquartile range and mean absolute deviation.

NODE.title: 6.SP.5c_3
NODE.description: Describe overall patterns in data sets as well as deviations from patterns.

NODE.title: 6.SP.5d_1
NODE.description: Relate choices for measures of center and variability to context.
